total_impedance_ori_txt.item: R4 and R2 connected in series so Rd=R4+R2=2 Ohm
R5 and Rd connected in parallel so Rc=R5*Rd/(R5+Rd)=1 Ohm
R3 and Rc connected in series so Rb=R3+Rc=2 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm

total_impedance_txt.item: R4 and R2 connected in series so Rd=R4+R2=2 Ohm
R5 and Rd connected in parallel so Rc=R5*Rd/(R5+Rd)=1 Ohm
R3 and Rc connected in series so Rb=R3+Rc=2 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R4?

solution.item: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R4 and R2 connected in series so Rd=R4+R2=2 Ohm
R5 and Rd connected in parallel so Rc=R5*Rd/(R5+Rd)=1 Ohm
R3 and Rc connected in series so Rb=R3+Rc=2 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R4
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 6 V.
(1) The components Rb,R1 connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 6 V.
(1) Rb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rb is Rb/Ra*6 V = 4 V.
(2) The components R3,Rc connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 4 V.
(2) Rc is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rc is Rc/Rb*4 V = 2 V.
(3) The components R5,Rd connected in parallel. The voltage on Rd is 2 V because the voltage on Rc is 2 V
(4) The components R4,R2 connected in series.
(4) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 2 V.
(4) R4 is in the voltage divider so the voltage on R4 is R4/Rd*2 V = 1 V.
